text: Secobarbital sodium (sold as Seconal) is a drug which is used to treat epilepsy and insomnia. Trade names include Seconal and reds. It was first synthesised in 1928. Like other barbiturates, it is fairly addictive. In many countries, this is an illegal drug, outside the medical context. Today, this drug is only used rarely; Barbiturates have been replaced by Benzodiazepine for many applications. Category:Drugs used in psychiatry Category:Organonitrogen compounds Category:Sodium compounds
title: Seconal
